cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: drifting northward, then turning northeast and accelerating toward Florida’s Big Bend and eventually across the Southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Florida coast between Indian Pass and Cedar Key (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA under Tropical Storm Watch; Anclote River to Indian Pass FL under Hurricane Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line FL under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Aripeka to Indian Pass (Big Bend) with eventual impacts spreading along coastal GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain-bands may bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<3% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible, generally less than 1 ft along Mississippi coast due to offshore flow on the storm’s western side.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent squally rain bands possible Wednesday night into Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal squalls and isolated tornado threat remain east of the port; operational disruptions expected to be minimal.
